Action.author: lovesh
Action.body: ~krw910 No, INDY-137 will only manifest of you delete the state database. Reason for this behavior is that we construct the entire HashStore (a data store used for storing Merkle Tree nodes) on startup, disregarding the existent HashStore data. We do this for the lack of a good integrity check mechanism. I think we need to create a general integrity check mechanism for all our data stores
